content:
{{knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-364-12-B |Item_parent=Fractures in children: epidemiological, diagnostic and therapeutic features |Item_parent_short=Fractures in children: epidemiological, diagnostic and therapeutic features |Rank=B |Title=Know how to diagnose complications of ankle fractures |Description=Know the risk of growth problems due to epiphysiodesis |Section=Follow-up and/or prognosis |Contributors= |Order=12}} Be aware of the high risk of epiphysiodesis after ankle epiphyseal detachment fractures in adolescents. Be aware of the risk of subsequent growth problems
.

question.title: What is a potential complication of ankle epiphyseal detachment fractures in adolescents?
question.description: A complication of ankle epiphyseal detachment fractures in adolescents

option_a.title: Growth problems due to premature closure of the growth plate
option_a.description: A possible complication of ankle epiphyseal detachment fractures in adolescents

option_b.title: Infection and sepsis
option_b.description: A possible complication of ankle epiphyseal detachment fractures in adolescents

option_c.title: Nerve damage and numbness
option_c.description: A possible complication of ankle epiphyseal detachment fractures in adolescents

option_d.title: Hematoma and swelling
option_d.description: A possible complication of ankle epiphyseal detachment fractures in adolescents

correct_option.title: A
correct_option.description: The correct letter of the option
